Generation II.Gold: Its milk is packed with nutrition, making it the ultimate beverage for the sick or weary.
Generation II.Silver: If it has just had a baby, the milk it produces contains much more nutrition than usual.
Generation II.Crystal: In order to milk a Miltank , one must have a knack for rhythmically pulling up and down on its udders.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Its milk is packed with nutrition, making it the ultimate beverage for the sick or weary. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) If it has just had a baby, the milk it produces contains much more nutrition than usual. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation VII.Sun: Its milk is high in calories and packed with nutrients. Therefore, if you drink too much of it, you may wind up with a body like Miltank's.
Generation VII.Moon: Most people raise it for its milk, but it's quite tough and strong, so it's also well suited for battle.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It produces over five gallons of milk a day. The higher the quality of the pastures it lives in, the richer and tastier its milk becomes.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Its milk is delicious and chock-full of nutrients. However, if you drink too much, it could make your stomach hurt, so be careful.

Generation VIII.Sword: Miltank produces highly nutritious milk, so it's been supporting the lives of people and other Pokémon since ancient times.
Generation VIII.Shield: This Pokémon needs to be milked every day, or else it will fall ill. The flavor of Miltank milk changes with the seasons.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It is said that kids who drink Miltank's milk grow up to become hearty, healthy adults.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It is said that kids who drink Miltank's milk grow up to become hearty, healthy adults.
